meanings.definition: Bring (goods or services) into a country from abroad for sale.
meanings.sent1: She reimports unique fabrics to sell in her boutique.
meanings.sent2: The company reimports electronics to meet the high demand.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally reimports the same product twice, doubling his inventory.
meanings.sent4: The chef reimports exotic spices to add a special touch to her dishes.
meanings.sent5: The farmer reimports rare seeds to grow new varieties of crops.

meanings.definition: Bring (goods or services) back into a country after they have been exported.
meanings.sent1: The business reimports the products to replenish their stock.
meanings.sent2: After the trade show, they reimport the promotional materials.
meanings.sent3: She reimports the souvenirs to keep as a memory of her travels.
meanings.sent4: The museum reimports the artifacts to display in a new exhibit.
meanings.sent5: He reimports the vintage cars to add to his collection.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing goods or services back into a country after they have been exported.
meanings.sent1: The reimports of luxury goods have increased this year.
meanings.sent2: The government tracks the reimports for economic analysis.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected reimports caused a delay in the supply chain.
meanings.sent4: She studied the history of reimports for her thesis.
meanings.sent5: The company's success is attributed to strategic reimports.
